subs.text: I made my first Sloane Peterson sighting of the summer today, 21 days in.
subs.rawText: I made my first Sloane Peterson sighting of the summer today, 21 days in.

subs.text: So begins what I expect is a Sloane Peterson Cluster Phenomenon, which is where, if you see one woman who looks like Sloane Peterson, you start seeing them everywhere for a few days, then none for two weeks.
subs.rawText: So begins what I expect is a Sloane Peterson Cluster Phenomenon, which is where, if you see one woman who looks like Sloane Peterson, you start seeing them everywhere for a few days, then none for two weeks.

subs.text: I‚Äôm going to Mississauga today by GO Transit. Cool, right?
subs.rawText: I‚Äôm going to Mississauga today by GO Transit. Cool, right?

subs.text: It was smooth sailing (on a train and then a bus) until I got to my stop, which Google Maps said was Financial Dr. and Derry Rd, but the GO Transit stop is labelled as Syntex Crt., a block away. Good thing I was paying attention!
subs.rawText: It was smooth sailing (on a train and then a bus) until I got to my stop, which Google Maps said was Financial Dr. and Derry Rd, but the GO Transit stop is labelled as Syntex Crt., a block away. Good thing I was paying attention!

subs.text: This plant near Financial Dr. and Syntex Crt. is right on a microconfluence. [link]
subs.rawText: This plant near Financial Dr. and Syntex Crt. is right on a microconfluence. https://t.co/MXVv67HcT4

subs.text: The trip to Mississauga and back took 5 hours (including an hour of waiting since I got there early), to do one thing, and exchange, and it was exhausting. Of course I forgot a part of the thing I was exchanging, but the lady had compassion for me and said don‚Äôt worry about it.
subs.rawText: The trip to Mississauga and back took 5 hours (including an hour of waiting since I got there early), to do one thing, and exchange, and it was exhausting. Of course I forgot a part of the thing I was exchanging, but the lady had compassion for me and said don‚Äôt worry about it.

subs.text: (I‚Äôm still going to mail the company the part, or sell it, or something, since I don‚Äôt have a use for it.)
subs.rawText: (I‚Äôm still going to mail the company the part, or sell it, or something, since I don‚Äôt have a use for it.)

subs.text: She assumed I drove there, because the whole built environment in that area assumes driving. I got the sense that a women on her break either laughed at me or took pity on me for walking there.
subs.rawText: She assumed I drove there, because the whole built environment in that area assumes driving. I got the sense that a women on her break either laughed at me or took pity on me for walking there.

subs.text: It was pleasant riding the train and the bus to get there and back, I‚Äôll give GO Transit that. It reminded me of my train/bus trips to America from B.C. It gave me the idea that maybe that‚Äôs how I go to the USA the next time, whenever that is.
subs.rawText: It was pleasant riding the train and the bus to get there and back, I‚Äôll give GO Transit that. It reminded me of my train/bus trips to America from B.C. It gave me the idea that maybe that‚Äôs how I go to the USA the next time, whenever that is.

subs.text: July 8

A couple of times recently, I made a mild joke that had women I didn‚Äôt know laugh their asses off. One was about when I didn‚Äôt have legroom at Massey Hall and I joked that it was just the way I liked it. Today I said to one, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt follow us, we don‚Äôt know where we‚Äôre going.‚Äù
subs.rawText: A couple of times recently, I made a mild joke that had women I didn‚Äôt know laugh their asses off. One was about when I didn‚Äôt have legroom at Massey Hall and I joked that it was just the way I liked it. Today I said to one, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt follow us, we don‚Äôt know where we‚Äôre going.‚Äù

subs.text: They were intended as mildly funny jokes, just to relieve the awkwardness (awkwardity?) of the situation, not for them to bust out laughing.
subs.rawText: They were intended as mildly funny jokes, just to relieve the awkwardness (awkwardity?) of the situation, not for them to bust out laughing.

subs.text: Maybe they were high? I can‚Äôt tell if someone is high just by looking at them.

subs.text: Pet peeve: When people write words like ‚Äúanxiousness‚Äù and ‚Äúbriefness‚Äù when there‚Äôs beautiful words like ‚Äúanxiety‚Äù and ‚Äúbrevity‚Äù just looking at them like in the distracted boyfriend meme.

subs.text: Saying them out loud, fine, I‚Äôll give you a pass. But when writing them out you have a chance to press the backspace key.
subs.rawText: Saying them out loud, fine, I‚Äôll give you a pass. But when writing them out you have a chance to press the backspace key.

subs.text: Pet peeve: People talking while I‚Äôm walking in front of them. I don‚Äôt have an explanation for it, it just gets on my nerves. I let people pass me when that happens.

subs.text: You know what‚Äôs irritating? News anchors talking over the first few words of a speech they are about to cover. You know what they could do instead, and very few people would care? Delay the feed of the speech ever so slightly so that we get to hear everything.
subs.rawText: You know what‚Äôs irritating? News anchors talking over the first few words of a speech they are about to cover. You know what they could do instead, and very few people would care? Delay the feed of the speech ever so slightly so that we get to hear everything.

subs.text: Sports broadcasts do it all the time, not so much for speeches or news conferences, but for the live events they cover, and it‚Äôs so fluid that hardly anybody notices.
subs.rawText: Sports broadcasts do it all the time, not so much for speeches or news conferences, but for the live events they cover, and it‚Äôs so fluid that hardly anybody notices.

subs.text: The next time you watch a baseball game on TV, notice how, when the broadcasts show a pitcher up close, they very slightly rewind the action once the pitch is actually made.
subs.rawText: The next time you watch a baseball game on TV, notice how, when the broadcasts show a pitcher up close, they very slightly rewind the action once the pitch is actually made.

subs.text: It‚Äôs possible, for fucking once, that I made a friend at a concert. I saw a guy who I was pretty sure came alone (I was right), and invited him to sit with me. He initially declined, but then came over and thanked me and talked to me every now and then throughout the show.
subs.rawText: It‚Äôs possible, for fucking once, that I made a friend at a concert. I saw a guy who I was pretty sure came alone (I was right), and invited him to sit with me. He initially declined, but then came over and thanked me and talked to me every now and then throughout the show.

subs.text: That‚Äôs a family trait, by the way: We believe we have a sense for people who look like they‚Äôd rather not be standing and offer them a seat, but then they politely decline.
